verses.verse: Then sang<WH7891> Deborah<WH1683> and Barak<WH1301> the son<WH1121> of Abinoam<WH42> on that day<WH3117>, saying<WH559>,
For that the leaders took the lead<WH6544> in Israel<WH3478>, For that the people<WH5971> offered<WH5068> themselves willingly<WH1288>, Bless ye Jehovah<WH3068>.

Hear <WH8085>, O ye kings<WH4428>; give ear<WH238>, O ye princes<WH7336>; I<WH7891>, even I, will sing unto Jehovah<WH3068>; I will sing<WH2167> praise to Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>.

Jehovah <WH3068>, when thou wentest forth<WH3318> out of Seir<WH8165>, When thou marchedst out<WH6805> of the field<WH7704> of Edom<WH123>, The earth<WH776> trembled<WH7493>, the heavens<WH8064> also dropped<WH5197>, Yea<WH5645>, the clouds dropped<WH5197> water<WH4325>.
The mountains<WH2022> quaked<WH5140> at the presence<WH6440> of Jehovah<WH3068>, Even yon Sinai<WH5514> at the presence<WH6440> of Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>.

In the days<WH3117> of Shamgar<WH8044> the son<WH1121> of Anath<WH6067>, In the days<WH3117> of Jael<WH3278>, the highways<WH734> were unoccupied<WH2308>, And the travellers<WH1980> walked<WH3212> through byways<WH6128>.
The rulers<WH6520> ceased<WH2308> in Israel<WH3478>, they ceased<WH2308>, Until that I Deborah<WH1683> arose<WH6965>, That I arose<WH6965> a mother<WH517> in Israel<WH3478>.
They chose<WH977> new<WH2319> gods<WH430>; Then was war<WH3901> in the gates<WH8179>: Was there a shield<WH4043> or spear<WH7420> seen<WH7200> Among forty<WH705> thousand<WH505> in Israel<WH3478>?
My heart<WH3820> is toward the governors<WH2710> of Israel<WH3478>, That offered themselves willingly<WH5068> among the people<WH5971>: Bless<WH1288> ye Jehovah<WH3068>.
Tell <WH7878> of it<WH7392>, ye that ride on white<WH6715> asses<WH860>, Ye that sit<WH3427> on rich carpets<WH4055>, And ye that walk<WH1980> by the way<WH1870>.

Far from the noise<WH6963> of archers<WH2686>, in the places of drawing water<WH4857>, There shall they rehearse<WH8567> the righteous acts<WH6666> of Jehovah<WH3068>, Even the righteous acts<WH6666> of his rule<WH6520> in Israel<WH3478>. Then the people<WH5971> of Jehovah<WH3068> went down<WH3381> to the gates<WH8179>.

Awake <WH5782>, awake<WH5782>, Deborah<WH1683>; Awake<WH5782>, awake<WH5782>, utter<WH1696> a song<WH7892>: Arise<WH6965>, Barak<WH1301>, and lead away thy<WH7628> captives<WH7617>, thou son<WH1121> of Abinoam<WH42>.
Then came down a remnant<WH8300> of the nobles<WH117> and the people<WH5971>; Jehovah<WH3068> came down for me against<WH7287> the mighty<WH1368>.

Out of Ephraim<WH669> came down they whose root<WH8328> is in Amalek<WH6002>; After<WH310> thee<WH1144>, Benjamin, among thy peoples<WH5971>; Out of Machir<WH4353> came down<WH3381> governors<WH2710>, And out of Zebulun<WH2074> they that handle<WH4900> the marshal<WH5608>'s staff<WH7626>.

And the princes<WH8269> of Issachar<WH3485> were with Deborah<WH1683>; As was Issachar<WH3485>, so was Barak<WH1301>; Into the valley<WH6010> they rushed<WH7971> forth at his feet<WH7272>. By the watercourses<WH6390> of Reuben<WH7205> There were great<WH1419> resolves<WH2711> of heart<WH3820>.

Why sattest<WH3427> thou among<WH996> the sheepfolds<WH4942>, To hear<WH8085> the pipings<WH8292> for the flocks<WH5739>? At the watercourses<WH6390> of Reuben<WH7205> There were great<WH1419> searchings<WH2714> of heart<WH3820>.

Gilead <WH1568> abode<WH7931> beyond<WH5676> the Jordan<WH3383>: And Dan<WH1835>, why did he remain<WH1481> in ships<WH591>? Asher<WH836> sat still<WH3427> at the haven<WH2348> of the sea<WH3220>, And abode<WH7931> by his creeks<WH4664>.
Zebulun <WH2074> was a people<WH5971> that jeoparded<WH2778> their lives<WH5315> unto the death<WH4191>, And Naphtali<WH5321>, upon the high places<WH4791> of the field<WH7704>.

The kings<WH4428> came<WH935> and fought<WH3898>; Then fought<WH3898> the kings<WH4428> of Canaan<WH3667>. In Taanach<WH8590> by the waters<WH4325> of Megiddo<WH4023>: They took<WH3947> no gain<WH1215> of money<WH3701>.
From heaven<WH8064> fought<WH3898> the stars<WH3556>, From their courses<WH4546> they fought<WH3898> against Sisera<WH5516>.
The river<WH5158> Kishon<WH7028> swept them away<WH1640>, That ancient<WH6917> river<WH5158>, the river<WH5158> Kishon<WH7028>. O my soul<WH5315>, march on<WH1869> with strength<WH5797>.
Then did the horsehoofs<WH6119> stamp<WH1986> By reason of the prancings<WH1726>, the prancings<WH1726> of their strong ones<WH47>.

Curse <WH779> ye Meroz<WH4789>, said<WH559> the angel<WH4397> of Jehovah<WH3068>. Curse<WH779> ye bitterly<WH779> the inhabitants<WH3427> thereof<WH935>, Because they came not to the help<WH5833> of Jehovah<WH3068>, To the help<WH5833> of Jehovah<WH3068> against the mighty<WH1368>.
Blessed <WH1288> above women<WH802> shall Jael<WH3278> be<WH802>, The wife of Heber<WH2268> the Kenite<WH7017>; Blessed<WH1288> shall she be above women<WH802> in the tent<WH168>.
He asked<WH7592> water<WH4325>, and she gave<WH5414> him milk<WH2461>; She brought him<WH7126> butter<WH2529> in a lordly<WH117> dish<WH5602>.

She put<WH7971> her hand<WH3027> to the tent-pin<WH3489>, And her right hand<WH3225> to the workmen<WH6001>'s hammer<WH1989>; And with the hammer she smote<WH1986> Sisera<WH5516>, she smote through<WH4277> his head<WH7218>; Yea<WH4272>, she pierced and struck through<WH2498> his temples<WH7541>.
At her feet<WH7272> he bowed<WH3766>, he fell<WH5307>, he lay<WH7901>; At her feet<WH7272> he bowed<WH3766>, he fell<WH5307>; Where<WH834> he bowed<WH3766>, there he fell down<WH5307> dead<WH7703>.

Through the window<WH2474> she looked<WH8259> forth<WH2980>, and cried, The mother<WH517> of Sisera cried<WH2980> through the lattice<WH822>, Why is his chariot<WH7393> so long<WH954> in coming<WH935>? Why tarry<WH309> the wheels<WH6471> of his chariots<WH4818>?
Her wise<WH2450> ladies<WH8282> answered<WH6030> her<WH7725>, Yea, she returned answer to herself<WH561>,

Have they not found<WH4672>, have they not divided<WH2505> the spoil<WH7998>? A damsel<WH7356>, two<WH7361> damsels to every<WH7218> man<WH1397>; To Sisera<WH5516> a spoil<WH7998> of dyed<WH6648> garments<WH7998>, A spoil of dyed<WH6648> garments embroidered<WH7553>, Of dyed<WH6648> garments embroidered on both sides<WH7553>, on the necks<WH6677> of the spoil<WH7998>?

So let all thine enemies<WH341> perish<WH6>, O Jehovah<WH3068>: But let them that love<WH157> him be as the sun<WH8121> when he goeth forth<WH3318> in his might<WH1369>. And the land<WH776> had rest<WH8252> forty<WH705> years<WH8141>.
